hint.text:
Irreducible factors cannot be broken down further.
Eg: \(x(2x+4y)\) can still be further reduced to \(2x(x+2y).\)

solution.text:
\(_{j}_a^2= _{j}_a \times a, _{j}_ab = _{j}_a \times b, _{j}_ac = _{j}_a \times c \), hence, \(_{j}_a\) is a common factor for all three terms.
Using distributive law,
\(-_{j}_a^2+_{j}_ab-_{j}_ac = _{j}_a(-a+b-c)\)
